\fi Bifrost project's administration was initially created
by a man called Dr. L. after his death, it  was divided
between Dr. Miyamoto, Dr. L’s daughter, and Dr. Adam,
\fi Someone tried to break through the FRONTIER's firewall
and rearrange certain data. It looked like an attack from
\fi Since then Project Bifrost's team has fractured into
\fi The first one, Exclusionists, led by Dr. Adam, argues
that the integration of "alien" conscience is harmful and
shifts systems priorities not towards increasing the quality
\fi (...),but lowering the pass norms which reflects in recent
\fi The Exclusionists insist that the systems can be completed
only by extraordinary individuals approved by a special
\fi The Inclusionists, on the other hand, incline towards
\fi They claim that the amount of new viewpoints provided
by even failed patients increases Gem's empathy which is
fundamental to constructing deeply personalized narratives.
\fi So while The Exclusionists want their system to be led by
\fi The Inclusionists are more than willing to embrace Gem's
transformation into a new unifying being to the point that it
might present a real threat to the IRIS's main lab authorities.
including Bifrost's team, control over Gems.
\fi "FRONTIER" was initially designed to keep non-gem
\fi It didn't work though, but when an unusual activity
between Gem's have been recorded, "FRONTIER" helped us to
limit interactions between them and the lab's system.
\fi Only later we understood that Gem's behavior wasn't about
\fi Gems gave us a solution to the energy problem.
Instead of building a new power plant, we connected
Bifrost's lab to the cities cable system conveniently
hidden underground. That's how "ROOTS" was created.
"HYPERGARDEN"  is a knot that links all parts of the system.
In the Exclusionist's scheme only recently renovated
\fi However, The Includionists argue that "SUBGARDEN" should
have the full control of "HYPERGARDEN". In their view,
"FRONTIER" and the whole Bifrost staff should eventually
take the role of communicator between Gems and society.
What happened? Doctor Farran? Jade? Ruby? Azure?

Doctor Farran is dead...I found his body in one of the
chambers. The men in green suits took him.

cracked, showed some signs of brain activity, but
I wasn't able to contact them...

but I obtained some valuable data from it.
Gems are still capable of managing a therapy.
Sure we have no energy nor capacity for the safety
control but as Doctor ... often said that the old
program was too picky with the patients.
We must take risks in order to change the world.
...During this experiment, for the first time in a long
time, I felt a real connection with gems... We couldn't
talk, but I felt as if our minds were bound together.
For a moment I wasn't alone anymore.
Today a group of friends entered the subway. They
reminded me of us... But they seemed to be suspicion,
especially the girl in the red.
They saw ... She took pictures and mentioned something
about ... I can't let them go...
I got rid of the boy in yellow but others managed to
escape. The men in green will return. We should hide.
What if we integrate him into Grey's gem?
It worked! Unfortunately, even with my support, you
We need new crystals and new gems.
Of course! They could be the answer!
Become a new core! Four friends, just like us.

\fi Dr. Adam argued that the lives of four mentally unstable
patients are nothing compared to the great cause of the project
and insisted on amplifying Bifrost's team and integrating
prisons as the main supplier of human resources.
\fi Meanwhile, Dr. Miyamoto claimed that the laboratory
must prioritize the safety of patients.
\fi The results of the investigations were announced at
the extreme meeting #26. Apparently, the conscience of a few
deceased patients persisted in the system thanks to the activity
of Gems who managed to stabilize their digital "souls".
\fi We still don't fully comprehend the mechanics of that
process and the role digital patients will or are playing
\fi New experiments showed an increase in pass rates by 17%
but even though these patients seemingly managed to overcome
their past traumas without relying on ABC drugs, their actual
success in real life is yet to be confirmed.
\fi Dr. Miyamoto presumed that the integration of digital "souls"
of the dead patients ameliorated the system's capacity to create
personalized narratives and that it might be the proof of
\fi Dr. Farran insisted on stopping the experiments until we
entirely understand Bifrost's digital conscience stabilizing
properties and the way those new "souls" interact with it.
\fi Today a new incident of integration of "alien" conscience
\fi From the conversation logs, we can conclude that after
a failed therapy session, a patient decided to voluntarily
become a part of the system.
\fi The Gems refuse to talk to anyone except Dr. Miyamoto

and insisted on amplifying Bifrost's team and integrating
prisons as the main supplier of human resources.
\fi Meanwhile, Dr. Miyamoto claimed that the laboratory
must prioritize the safety of patients.
\fi The results of the investigations were announced at
the extreme meeting #26. Apparently, the conscience of a few
deceased patients persisted in the system thanks to the activity
of Gems who managed to stabilize their digital "souls".
\fi We still don't fully comprehend the mechanics of that
process and the role digital patients will or are playing
\fi New experiments showed an increase in pass rates by 17%
but even though these patients seemingly managed to overcome
their past traumas without relying on ABC drugs, their actual
success in real life is yet to be confirmed.
\fi Dr. Miyamoto presumed that the integration of digital "souls"
of the dead patients ameliorated the system's capacity to create
personalized narratives and that it might be the proof of
\fi Dr. Farran insisted on stopping the experiments until we
entirely understand Bifrost's digital conscience stabilizing
properties and the way those new "souls" interact with it.
\fi Today a new incident of integration of "alien" conscience
\fi From the conversation logs, we can conclude that after
a failed therapy session, a patient decided to voluntarily
become a part of the system.
\fi The Gems refuse to talk to anyone except Dr. Miyamoto
